intro: Caelestina sclerophylla, commonly known as the bluebells of the south, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is known for its ability to thrive in dry conditions. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens in arid regions.
